intro.name: I'm Sean
intro.greeting: Welcome to my personal portfolio website.
intro.description: accessible, responsive, and modular web interfaces.

about.p1: Based in Paris, I'm a trilingual developer (French, English, German) who began my career as a language teacher in academic and professional settings. My adventure into web development began in 2022, where I started with the basics of responsive design and DOM manipulation, and quickly became hooked. I loved seeing the fruits of my labour come to life on screen, and the problem-solving aspect quickly became my favorite part of programming.
about.p2: That passion led me to change career paths entirely. In 2023, I began a two-year work-study diploma with OpenClassrooms, focusing on JavaScript and React. At the same time, I had the opportunity to apply my skills in a professional setting at Abeille Assurances, where I worked as a hybrid front-end developer and web integrator.
about.p3: Today, I have a solid core stack in React and Next.js, and I'm also familiar with Typescript and some Angular concepts. I have started looking into a couple of back-end technologies such as Node.js and Prisma in order to round out my skills and become more full-stack. I'm confident working with JavaScript both inside and outside of frameworks, building applications from scratch, manipulating the DOM directly, and structuring logic without relying on abstractions.
about.p4: Beyond building scalable, reusable UI components, I'm comfortable thinking in terms of front-end architecture â€” designing modular systems, managing state predictably, and ensuring maintainability across teams. I pay close attention to accessibility, performance, and responsive design, and I enjoy structuring codebases that are clean, intuitive, and easy to onboard.
about.p5: I'm always eager to explore new technologies and am currently seeking a full-time position in web development.
about.p6: Teaching taught me to explain complex ideas clearly, and coding allows me to transform those ideas into tangible solutions.
